hotspots.label: Head and Eyes
hotspots.fact: This insect larva has a brown head with eyes that help it see and find food in the soil. Different organisms have different body parts that help them survive in their habitats, like how this larva's small eyes work well in dark soil.

vocabulary.definition: A young insect that looks different from an adult insect and goes through big changes as it grows.

hotspots.label: Curved White Body
hotspots.fact: This C-shaped body is soft and flexible, which helps the larva move through soil and hide from predators. As insects grow and change in their life cycle, they look very different from when they become adults.

vocabulary.definition: The stages a living thing goes through from birth to growing up to having babies of its own.

hotspots.label: Legs and Segments
hotspots.fact: You can see small legs on this larva's body! Insects have segmented bodies made of parts that work together to help them move, eat, and grow. These body structures help the larva survive in the soil where it lives.

vocabulary.definition: The separate connected sections that make up an insect's body, like rings stacked on top of each other.

hotspots.label: Soil Habitat
hotspots.fact: This larva lives in soil, which is its habitatâ€”the place where it finds food, water, and shelter. Many organisms live in soil and depend on it to survive, making soil an important part of ecosystems.

vocabulary.definition: The place where a plant or animal lives that has everything it needs to survive, like food, water, and shelter.
